blog.name: zajelimilogin
blog.title: Dream a little bigger, darling.
blog.description:
Woman.
Determined.
Braided.

What else?
Normality is overrated.
Wibbly wobbly, timey wimey.
Black, two sugars. I'll be upstairs.
One more miracle, please.

You mustn't be afraid to dream a little bigger, darling.

But a lot of it is also dedicated to Tony Stark.

Requests are always open. (Unless I say something different)  
Also, TAKE YOUR HATE ELSEWHERE I DON'T WHAT TO HEAR NONE OF IT!

summary: Day 27 - Ski
title: Day 27 - Ski
body:
Characters: Tony Stark x Reader
Words: 400+
A/N: This is just a small drabble

It was a long time since Tony had promised to teach you how to ski. Today was the day, having taken a break from the ever so busy every day that the two of you faced each morning when you woke up. Tony had woken you up earlier than you had ever done yourself, leaving you wondering why he had done so. It wasn’t until later when you were sitting in his jet that he told you why. Sure, it was winter and there was snow, but never in your life had you thought that Tony Stark would teach you how to ski in Aspen. You had thought that he would just take you to Canada or something. Since that was far closer to New York than Colorado was.

“Honestly I had forgotten about the promise you had made me,” You smiled as you stepped out of the jet. Tony was standing wrapped in a big jacket, already with a pair of skis in his arms. “Sure, you did, but how could I forget about something like this, there’s nothing like someone’s first time skiing. It’s almost like when a child first rides their bike without the help of a parent,” He smiled and handed you the skis. You noticed that leaning against the jet was another pair, that must’ve been Tony’s.

After a few hours, you still hadn’t gotten the hang of it and hadn’t left the bunny slope either. You were starting to get annoyed with trying to ski. But Tony kept on encouraging you to try harder and harder as he showed you how it was done. “Remember that time, when you had just gotten to me when I almost just gave up on you. But you changed my mind, look where we are today!” Tony yelled to you from the end of the hill, as you fell face down in the snow. 

You remembered that time almost as if it was yesterday. You were scared, had just come to a new place, and you didn’t know what to do. Meaning that you isolated yourself for the first long period of time, with Tony. He had confronted both Pepper and Happy, but no one knew just exactly what to do. Not until the day when you finally started helping him understand. Now was his turn to, sort of, pay back what you had helped him with then.

Believing in yourself was the key to not falling down. And in the end, you knew how to ski, with the help of Tony you could finally cross learn to ski off of your bucket list.

summary: Last Name Keener, First Name Harley
title: Last Name Keener, First Name Harley
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2s8lsaN

by SmolTownFangirl

IronMan-DidNothingWrong: I love spiders, they just, exist man.

IronMansMechanic: PETER BUD WHAT THE FUCK

(Peter and Harley are internet friends. Harley’s mom dies, and he gets adopted by Tony because Tony is obviously the best choice for him and his sister to go too. Harley meets Peter at school. Instant. Hatred.)

Words: 3512, Chapters: 1/10, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of First Name Harley, Last Name Stark

  • Fandoms: The Avengers (Marvel Movies), Iron Man (Movies), Marvel Cinematic Universe, Spider-Man: Homecoming (2017), Captain America (Movies)
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M, M/M

  • Relationships: Pepper Potts/Tony Stark, Harley Keener & Tony Stark, Tony Stark & Original Female Character(s), Harley Keener & Pepper Potts, Pepper Potts & Original Female Character, Peter Parker & Tony Stark, Ned Leeds & Peter Parker, Harley Keener & Peter Parker, Harley Keener/Peter Parker

blog.name: itismarvelicious
blog.title: Qu'est-ce que j'irais faire au paradis ?
blog.description: French. 25. | Fixing Avengers: Endgame here. | I take prompts. | Pepperony mainly.

summary: Wish upon a star
body:
Wish upon a star

Post Infinity War. What if Tony had been lost in space longer than we thought? Four year old Morgan Stark waits for her daddy to come home from the stars.

Mommy says to look at the stars. Daddy is in the stars. There are a lot of stars, but I know which one daddy is. He’s the brightest. Mom says the brighter it becomes, the closer he gets.

“Why is daddy in the sky?”

“He flew there. Because he is the Iron Man.”

That makes no sense, Friday said men and women are made of flesh and bones and muscles and blood but we only have 3 to 4 grams of iron in our bodies, which is very little, so we can’t be iron humans. So mom shows me the iron armours dad created all by himself.

“Are you an Iron Woman too?”

“No”, mommy laughs.

“Can I be an Iron Girl?”

She laughs again. “Maybe someday.”

“When daddy comes home, he can teach me.”

Mommy’s sister is pregnant, she’s waiting for her baby. I’m waiting for my daddy.

“Why is Daddy so long to come?”

Sometimes Uncle Steve has to fly to come and visit us but he’s very fast. He calls me in the night and he says he’s coming tomorrow and tomorrow he is there to have breakfast with me.

“Because he’s very, very far away”

“But I can see him.”

“Because he shines very bright so we know he’s coming.”

“Or maybe he’s making signs. Maybe he’s lost and he’s calling for us so we can help him come home.”

Sometimes we take the telescope and try to look at him closer, but we can’t hear him. So mommy brought an iron helmet and said if the red light flickers, it means daddy is calling.

Tonight I am sad, because I can’t find daddy’s star. All the stars are shining but his is not there in the sky. Sometimes it’s too cloudy but it’s not the same, mom says he’s just playing hide-and-seek behind the clouds. Tonight he is just gone.

That’s when I hear him. It beeps. Beep. Beep. Beep. And I see the red light in the iron helmet. Mommy’s seen it too and she puts the helmet on and I can’t hear anything anymore but then she takes it off and she’s crying.

Mommy cries often, she says it’s because her heart hurts. I banged my head really hard the other day and I cried too so I know what hurting feels like. But I’m good now. I wish mommy’s heart stopped hurting. Uncle Rhodey said daddy used to fix things, maybe he can fix her heart when he comes back.

“Did you hear daddy?”

“Yes”

“Is he coming home?”

“He’s lost.”

“So we have to rescue him.”

Mom smiles, which is strange because she’s still crying, I don’t know how we can both cry and smile at the same time. “You’re right. It’s time for me to be Iron Woman.”

Tomorrow I look at the sky to look for Iron Mommy. Aunt May is looking after me. Mommy and Uncle Steve and Uncle Rhodey and Aunt Nat and Uncle Bruce have all left for the sky to rescue daddy. I look in the day but it’s too bright and I look in the night but it’s too dark.

I’m waiting for my mommy and daddy.

I ask aunt May if we can decorate the Christmas tree and she says yes. I know it is not Christmas yet because I haven’t eaten all the chocolates in my advent calendar but I close my eyes and wish for daddy and mommy to be home tomorrow.

“Good morning, baby girl.”

I open my eyes and there is daddy. There is daddy and mommy and there are both crying and smiling.

“Does your heart hurt too?” I ask daddy.

He shakes his head and laughs and his tears fall on my face. “Not anymore.”

I touch his heart, it has a light. “I saw you in the sky.”

Daddy holds me really really tight and kisses my forehead, one, two, three, four, five… And I can’t count after fifty. “I’m here now.”

We finish decorating the Christmas tree. Daddy and I put on the Christmas tree topper. It’s a star.

We finish decorating the Christmas tree. Daddy and I put on the Christmas tree topper. It’s a star.

trail.content_raw:
Wish upon a star

Post Infinity War. What if Tony had been lost in space longer than we thought? Four year old Morgan Stark waits for her daddy to come home from the stars.

Mommy says to look at the stars. Daddy is in the stars. There are a lot of stars, but I know which one daddy is. He’s the brightest. Mom says the brighter it becomes, the closer he gets.

“Why is daddy in the sky?”

“He flew there. Because he is the Iron Man.”

That makes no sense, Friday said men and women are made of flesh and bones and muscles and blood but we only have 3 to 4 grams of iron in our bodies, which is very little, so we can’t be iron humans. So mom shows me the iron armours dad created all by himself.

“Are you an Iron Woman too?”

“No”, mommy laughs.

“Can I be an Iron Girl?”

She laughs again. “Maybe someday.”

“When daddy comes home, he can teach me.”

Mommy’s sister is pregnant, she’s waiting for her baby. I’m waiting for my daddy.

“Why is Daddy so long to come?”

Sometimes Uncle Steve has to fly to come and visit us but he’s very fast. He calls me in the night and he says he’s coming tomorrow and tomorrow he is there to have breakfast with me.

“Because he’s very, very far away”

“But I can see him.”

“Because he shines very bright so we know he’s coming.”

“Or maybe he’s making signs. Maybe he’s lost and he’s calling for us so we can help him come home.”

Sometimes we take the telescope and try to look at him closer, but we can’t hear him. So mommy brought an iron helmet and said if the red light flickers, it means daddy is calling.

Tonight I am sad, because I can’t find daddy’s star. All the stars are shining but his is not there in the sky. Sometimes it’s too cloudy but it’s not the same, mom says he’s just playing hide-and-seek behind the clouds. Tonight he is just gone.

That’s when I hear him. It beeps. Beep. Beep. Beep. And I see the red light in the iron helmet. Mommy’s seen it too and she puts the helmet on and I can’t hear anything anymore but then she takes it off and she’s crying.

Mommy cries often, she says it’s because her heart hurts. I banged my head really hard the other day and I cried too so I know what hurting feels like. But I’m good now. I wish mommy’s heart stopped hurting. Uncle Rhodey said daddy used to fix things, maybe he can fix her heart when he comes back.

“Did you hear daddy?”

“Yes”

“Is he coming home?”

“He’s lost.”

“So we have to rescue him.”

Mom smiles, which is strange because she’s still crying, I don’t know how we can both cry and smile at the same time. “You’re right. It’s time for me to be Iron Woman.”

Tomorrow I look at the sky to look for Iron Mommy. Aunt May is looking after me. Mommy and Uncle Steve and Uncle Rhodey and Aunt Nat and Uncle Bruce have all left for the sky to rescue daddy. I look in the day but it’s too bright and I look in the night but it’s too dark.

I’m waiting for my mommy and daddy.

I ask aunt May if we can decorate the Christmas tree and she says yes. I know it is not Christmas yet because I haven’t eaten all the chocolates in my advent calendar but I close my eyes and wish for daddy and mommy to be home tomorrow.

“Good morning, baby girl.”

I open my eyes and there is daddy. There is daddy and mommy and there are both crying and smiling.

“Does your heart hurt too?” I ask daddy.

He shakes his head and laughs and his tears fall on my face. “Not anymore.”

I touch his heart, it has a light. “I saw you in the sky.”

Daddy holds me really really tight and kisses my forehead, one, two, three, four, five… And I can’t count after fifty. “I’m here now.”

We finish decorating the Christmas tree. Daddy and I put on the Christmas tree topper. It’s a star.
trail.content:
Wish upon a star

Post Infinity War. What if Tony had been lost in space longer than we thought? Four year old Morgan Stark waits for her daddy to come home from the stars.

Mommy says to look at the stars. Daddy is in the stars. There are a lot of stars, but I know which one daddy is. He’s the brightest. Mom says the brighter it becomes, the closer he gets.

“Why is daddy in the sky?”

“He flew there. Because he is the Iron Man.”

That makes no sense, Friday said men and women are made of flesh and bones and muscles and blood but we only have 3 to 4 grams of iron in our bodies, which is very little, so we can’t be iron humans. So mom shows me the iron armours dad created all by himself.

“Are you an Iron Woman too?”

“No”, mommy laughs.

“Can I be an Iron Girl?”

She laughs again. “Maybe someday.”

“When daddy comes home, he can teach me.”

Mommy’s sister is pregnant, she’s waiting for her baby. I’m waiting for my daddy.

“Why is Daddy so long to come?”

Sometimes Uncle Steve has to fly to come and visit us but he’s very fast. He calls me in the night and he says he’s coming tomorrow and tomorrow he is there to have breakfast with me.

“Because he’s very, very far away”

“But I can see him.”

“Because he shines very bright so we know he’s coming.”

“Or maybe he’s making signs. Maybe he’s lost and he’s calling for us so we can help him come home.”

Sometimes we take the telescope and try to look at him closer, but we can’t hear him. So mommy brought an iron helmet and said if the red light flickers, it means daddy is calling.

Tonight I am sad, because I can’t find daddy’s star. All the stars are shining but his is not there in the sky. Sometimes it’s too cloudy but it’s not the same, mom says he’s just playing hide-and-seek behind the clouds. Tonight he is just gone.

That’s when I hear him. It beeps. Beep. Beep. Beep. And I see the red light in the iron helmet. Mommy’s seen it too and she puts the helmet on and I can’t hear anything anymore but then she takes it off and she’s crying.

Mommy cries often, she says it’s because her heart hurts. I banged my head really hard the other day and I cried too so I know what hurting feels like. But I’m good now. I wish mommy’s heart stopped hurting. Uncle Rhodey said daddy used to fix things, maybe he can fix her heart when he comes back.

“Did you hear daddy?”

“Yes”

“Is he coming home?”

“He’s lost.”

“So we have to rescue him.”

Mom smiles, which is strange because she’s still crying, I don’t know how we can both cry and smile at the same time. “You’re right. It’s time for me to be Iron Woman.”

Tomorrow I look at the sky to look for Iron Mommy. Aunt May is looking after me. Mommy and Uncle Steve and Uncle Rhodey and Aunt Nat and Uncle Bruce have all left for the sky to rescue daddy. I look in the day but it’s too bright and I look in the night but it’s too dark.

I’m waiting for my mommy and daddy.

I ask aunt May if we can decorate the Christmas tree and she says yes. I know it is not Christmas yet because I haven’t eaten all the chocolates in my advent calendar but I close my eyes and wish for daddy and mommy to be home tomorrow.

“Good morning, baby girl.”

I open my eyes and there is daddy. There is daddy and mommy and there are both crying and smiling.

“Does your heart hurt too?” I ask daddy.

He shakes his head and laughs and his tears fall on my face. “Not anymore.”

I touch his heart, it has a light. “I saw you in the sky.”

Daddy holds me really really tight and kisses my forehead, one, two, three, four, five… And I can’t count after fifty. “I’m here now.”

We finish decorating the Christmas tree. Daddy and I put on the Christmas tree topper. It’s a star.

summary:
Tony: For the last time, I'm not getting my butt frozen off!
Peter: its snowing Mr Stark!...it would be wrong to not play in...
body:
Tony: For the last time, I’m not getting my butt frozen off!

Peter: its snowing Mr Stark!…it would be wrong to not play in it..

Tony: No No No No

*Peter huffs and sits on the ground looking sad*

Tony *sighs*: What are you doing?

Peter: Making you feel guilty

Tony: That’s not gonna work kiddo..

Tony:…

Peter: *puppy sounds*

Tony*sighs*:You little piece of shit!

Peter: :)

Besides mediocre art I do mediocre edits as well 😀 
This one is based off of an older rp with my friend where Tony and Stephen...
body:
Besides mediocre art I do mediocre edits as well 😀

This one is based off of an older rp with my friend where Tony and Stephen were dating and people started being suspicious after the boys went together to a gala. So yeah, here you have what was on the front pages of magazines the next day 😁
